excerpt: Museum of art and sculpture from the 13th to 20th centuries, in a 16th-century palladium building.
detail_description: Palazzo Chiericati is a 16th-century Palladian building that houses a museum of art and sculpture spanning from the 13th to the 20th centuries. Designed by Palladio, it features an imposing facade and is considered one of his finest works. The Civic Art Gallery inside showcases original collections of Venetian works of art, including pieces by Tintoretto, Veronese, Sansovino, and others.
name: Palazzo Chiericati
address: Piazza Matteotti, 37/39, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Residences Teatro Olimpico is a historic building opposite the Museo Civico, originally designed by Palladio and completed by Vincenzo Scamozzi. The Renaissance-style theater is made of wood and stucco, resembling ancient theaters. The location in the historic center offers comfortable apartments with all amenities, providing a homely feel for guests. Visitors can enjoy the warm hospitality of Mrs. Caterina and experience five-star treatment with attention to detail.
name: Residences Teatro Olimpico
address: Piazza Matteotti, 1, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Corso Andrea Palladio is the bustling main street of Vicenza, located just northwest of Piazza dei Signori. The street is adorned with magnificent palaces, many of which were designed by the renowned architect Andrea Palladio. One notable landmark along this thoroughfare is the Palazzo del Comune, a splendid building crafted by Vincenzo Scamozzi in the early 1600s.
name: Corso Andrea Palladio
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: 16th-century hilltop villa built by Andrea Palladio, now used for cultural & corporate events.
detail_description: Villa la Rotonda is a 16th-century hilltop villa designed by Andrea Palladio, known for hosting cultural and corporate events. It is featured in the Four Books of Architecture as a suburban residence with service rooms in the basement and a grand circular hall on the main floor. The surrounding romantic park offers stunning views of the cultivated land.
name: Villa la Rotonda
address: Via della Rotonda, 45, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Baroque palace from 1676, plus a museum with ancient ceramics, Russian icons & 1700s Venetian art.
detail_description: Palazzo Leoni Montanari is a late Baroque palace in Vicenza, standing out from the city's predominantly Palladian Renaissance style. Lavishly decorated interiors feature cherubs, mythological characters, and intricate details like dragons and giants. The museum within showcases ancient Greek ceramics, 20th-century modernist works, and Venetian art from the 1700s. Notable pieces include an entire hall of paintings by Pietro Longhi.
name: Palazzo Leoni Montanari
address: Contrà Santa Corona, 25, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: In the heart of Vicenza's historic old town stands the Chiesa di Santa Corona, a 13th-century Gothic church known for housing a precious relic - a thorn from Christ's Crown of Thorns. The interior boasts remarkable paintings such as Giovanni Bellini's Baptism of Christ and Veronese's Adoration of the Magi. One of its main attractions is the Cappella Valmarana, believed to be designed by renowned architect Andrea Palladio.
name: Chiesa di Santa Corona
address: Contrà Santa Corona, 2, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Former 16th-century palace with ornate balconies & rich stucco decorations portraying battle scenes.
detail_description: In the heart of Vicenza lies the Loggia del Capitaniato, a 16th-century palace adorned with intricate balconies and elaborate stucco decorations depicting historical battle scenes. This majestic building is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site that encompasses the city and its surrounding Palladian villas.
name: Loggia del Capitaniato
address: Piazza dei Signori, 1, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Peaceful green space with paths & statuary, plus a pavilion on a circular island in a manmade lake.
detail_description: Parco Querini, located in the north-eastern part of Vicenza's old town center, offers a peaceful retreat with its lush greenery and charming features. The park is bordered by the river Bacchiglione and the Astichello tributary, as well as the Venetian walls along Viale Rodolfi. It derives its name from Palazzo Querini and features eighteenth-century statues and sculptures.
name: Parco Querini
address: Viale Mariano Rumor, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: When visiting Vicenza, don't miss out on the charming Palazzina di Villa Valmarana ai Nani. This must-see attraction boasts precious 14th-century frescoes and stunning statuary set amidst beautiful little gardens. The villa and its lovely landscaping offer a delightful setting to enjoy a cup of coffee while admiring the historical artwork. It's definitely worth a visit for those who appreciate art, history, and picturesque surroundings in Vicenza.
name: Palazzina di Villa Valmarana ai Nani
address: Via dei Nani, 2, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: When in Vicenza, a visit to Piazza dei Signori is a must. This main square is an essential stop for any visitor to the city. It's surrounded by historic buildings and offers a charming atmosphere that captures the essence of Vicenza.
name: Piazza dei Signori
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Piazza dei Signori is a must-visit in Vicenza, offering a rich atmosphere for all tastes. It is located near Corso Palladio, the main street where you can find everything you need for a magical experience in Vicenza. The square is also home to the Basilica Palladiana, making it a significant point of reference for art lovers and anyone who enjoys being amazed by beautiful architecture.
name: Piazza dei Signori
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Vicenza is a city in the Veneto region of northeast Italy. It’s known for the elegant buildings designed by the 16th-century architect Andrea Palladio. These include the Palladian Basilica and the Palazzo Chiericati, now home to an art gallery. Nearby, also by Palladio, the Teatro Olimpico replicates a classic outdoor theater, indoors. On the outskirts of town, the hilltop Villa La Rotonda has 4 identical facades.
detail_description: Vicenza, located in the Veneto region of Italy, is renowned for its exquisite architecture designed by the 16th-century architect Andrea Palladio. The city boasts elegant buildings such as the Palladian Basilica, Palazzo Chiericati which now houses an art gallery, and the indoor replica of a classic outdoor theater called Teatro Olimpico. Additionally, on the outskirts of Vicenza sits Villa La Rotonda with its four identical facades.
name: Vicenza
address: 36100 Province of Vicenza, Italy

detail_description: La Rotonda is a hidden gem with a Palladian influence, similar to the United States Capitol building and Thomas Jefferson's Monticello. It offers a fixed lunch menu for 10 euros, including water, wine, and coffee. The restaurant also serves delicious paella. Visitors praise the excellent customer service and recommend trying the paella for an enjoyable dining experience.
name: La Rotonda
address: Via Monte Nero, 1, 36040 Marola VI, Italy

excerpt: Elegant villa built in 1669, with frescoes painted by Tiepolo in 1757 & stone sculptures of dwarves.
detail_description: Valmarana Villa, also known as Villa Valmarana ai Nani, is an elegant 17th-century villa located near Vicenza. The villa features stunning frescoes painted by Giambattista Tiepolo in 1757 and stone sculptures of dwarves adorning its walls. The property is surrounded by beautifully manicured lawns and flower arrangements, creating a picturesque setting.
name: Valmarana Villa To The Dwarfs Vicenza
address: Via dei Nani, 8, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Iconic 16th-century building designed by famous architect Palladio housing cultural exhibitions.
detail_description: The Palladian Basilica, a 16th-century masterpiece designed by the renowned architect Palladio, is a cultural hub in Vicenza. The building underwent renovations in 2012 and is surrounded by grand aristocratic palaces like Loggia del Capitaniato and Palazzo Chiericati. Visitors can explore the nearby Casa Pigafetta and the iconic Rotonda villa, both designed by Palladio.
name: Palladian Basilica
address: Piazza dei Signori, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Thiene, located in Vicenza, is a 15th-century architectural gem that was expanded by Palladio at the request of the Thiene brothers. Although the original design was never fully realized, the building stands as a tribute to Palladio's genius. The facade features rustic stone and plastered bricks on the lower level and refined Corinthian features on the upper level.
name: Palazzo Thiene
address: Contrà, Via S. Gaetano Thiene, 11, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Il Giardino del Teatro Olimpico is a hidden gem that transports you back in time. Accessible through a charming 17th-century door flanked by grand columns, this intimate green oasis is adorned with various statues and remnants from the Roman era, creating an enchanting atmosphere. Visitors can also appreciate the quaint loggia of Palazzo del Territorio nestled within the garden. While some maintenance work may be ongoing, it doesn't detract from the serene beauty and historical significance of this lovely space.
name: Il Giardino del Teatro Olimpico
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Chic museum devoted to a 16th-century Venetian architect, featuring interactive video, art & models.
detail_description: Palazzo Barbaran da Porto, located in Vicenza, is a chic museum dedicated to the 16th-century Venetian architect Andrea Palladio. It houses the Palladio Museum and serves as the seat of CISA (International Centre of Architectural Studies). The museum features interactive videos, art displays, and models showcasing Palladio's works. One of his most remarkable creations is the Teatro Olimpico, which leaves visitors in awe.
name: Palazzo Barbaran da Porto
address: Palazzo Barbaran, Contrà Porti, 11, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Loggia Valmarana, also known as Valmarana Salvi gardens, is a historic site located in Vicenza. Built in 1591 by a student of Andrea Palladio at the request of Gian Luigi Valmarana, it was intended to be a meeting place for intellectuals and academics. The loggia features a stunning facade with arches that can be seen from the adjacent park.
name: Loggia Valmarana
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Vicenza, often overshadowed by its nearby sibling Verona, boasts a rich historical and artistic heritage. The city's main drag, Corso Palladio, showcases grand palazzos built 500 years ago by local dignitaries. This area is named after the renowned Renaissance architect Andrea Palladio. Visitors can explore the Giardini Salvi, a charming garden at the beginning of Corso Palladio that houses one of Palladio's famous buildings - the Loggia Valmarana.
name: Vicenza
address: Piazzale della Stazione, 21, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Terrazza di Monte Berico is a must-see when visiting Vicenza. It's located on the Monte Berico, where you can visit the Santuario della Madonna, a 15th-century minor basilica with artwork by Paolo Veronese. The Piazzale alla Vittoria in front of the church offers breathtaking panoramic views over Vicenza and the Veneto region.
name: Terrazza di Monte Berico
address: Piazzale della Vittoria, 7, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Catholic place of worship from the 1500s with an original Gothic facade & a dome by Andrea Palladio.
detail_description: The Cattedrale di Santa Maria Annunciata is a Roman Catholic place of worship located in Vicenza, built during the late 15th century and completed a century later. It features an original Gothic facade made of brick, enveloped by white and red marble that underwent extensive renovations after being damaged during World War II. The iconic cupola was designed by Andrea Palladio, while inside the building you can find a 14th-century triptych created by Lorenzo Veneziano.
name: Cathedral Santa Maria Annunciata
address: Piazzetta Duomo, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Museum of Jewelry is a must-see for jewelry enthusiasts, featuring a diverse collection from around the world. While some pieces are wearable, many are extravagant and not intended for everyday use. The museum's focus is solely on jewelry, with only a few paintings and sculptures on display. Visitors should note that English may not be widely spoken by staff. Situated in Vincenza, it offers a detailed presentation of Italian jewelry tradition and provides an enriching experience for beginners and experts alike.
name: Museum of Jewelry
address: Basilica Palladiana, Piazza dei Signori, 44, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Valmarana Braga is a stunning civilian residence designed by Palladio, now housing the Vicenza Town Museum. The museum boasts an impressive art collection, including significant works from the sixteenth century. Visitors can take a guided tour of the palace to learn about its historical significance and then embark on a comfortable Palladian E-bike journey to reach Villa La Rotonda, another iconic work by the renowned architect.
name: Palazzo Valmarana Braga
address: Corso Antonio Fogazzaro, 16, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Torrione, a majestic medieval tower, stands as the only remaining part of Vicenza's once grand Scaliger Castle. It greatly influences the scenery of the city's historic core and now serves as an exhibition venue for contemporary art on its upper levels. The architectural design is flawless, and within lies a stunning museum showcasing exquisite artwork that is definitely worth visiting. Its sheer presence commands respect and admiration, making it an exceptional tourist attraction worthy of recognition.
name: Torrione di Porta Castello
address: Corso Andrea Palladio, 1, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Museo di Santa Corona is an archaeological museum that holds historical significance as the original burial site of Andrea Palladio. However, its main claim to fame lies in housing a thorn from the crown of thorns worn by Jesus. This precious artifact was gifted by Louis IX of France to Bishop Bartolomeo di Breganze. The museum is divided into two sections, one dedicated to natural history and the other showcasing various exhibits.
name: Museo di Santa Corona
address: Contrà Santa Corona, 4, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Vicenzaoro is a premier jewelry trade fair that stands out as one of the largest and most significant events in the industry, held in the charming city of Vicenza. Known for its rich historical and cultural backdrop, this event showcases Italy's renowned craftsmanship in jewelry design. Attendees can explore an impressive array of exhibitors, from brands to manufacturers, alongside engaging workshops and insightful discussions led by industry experts. The Design Room has become a highlight for many visitors, blending contemporary aesthetics with haute couture elegance.
name: Vicenzaoro
address: Quartiere Fieristico di Vicenza, Via Oreficeria, 16, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Matteotti is a must-visit square in Vicenza, offering a glimpse of the grandiose Palladian Palazzo Chiericati, now housing the city's civic art museum. The museum boasts an impressive collection of sketches by Palladio and notable artworks by renowned artists such as Jacopo Bassano, Tintoretto, Tiepolo, and Van Dyck.
name: Piazza Matteotti
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: The first covered theater anywhere in Europe, built in the 16th century & still hosting productions.
detail_description: The Olympic Theater, also known as Teatro Olimpico, is a historic landmark in Vicenza, Europe's first covered theater built in the 16th century. Commissioned by the Olympic Academy, it was designed to host performances and intellectual debates. The theater consists of three rooms with impressive frescoes dating back to 1647 and original oil lamps from 1585 on display.
name: Olympic Theater
address: Piazza Matteotti, 11, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Church with Gothic & Baroque elements, ornate mosaics & a Virgin Mary statue, plus Vicenza vistas.
detail_description: The Basilica of St. Mary of Mount Berico is a stunning church in Vicenza, known for its blend of Gothic and Baroque architecture, adorned with intricate mosaics and featuring a remarkable statue of the Virgin Mary. The basilica offers breathtaking views of Vicenza and its surroundings. Visitors can also explore the free museum within the sanctuary, showcasing sacred artifacts and providing panoramic vistas of the city's renowned villas.
name: Basilica of St. Mary of Mount Berico
address: Viale Dieci Giugno, 87, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Duck pond & angling spot with an adjoining rose garden overlooking by a classic palladian terrace.
detail_description: Salvi Gardens Vicenza is a charming and peaceful park located just outside the old town gate, Porta Castello. It features a duck pond where visitors can admire the ducks and their ducklings, although feeding them is not allowed. The park also boasts a beautiful rose garden and statues that add to its serene atmosphere. Additionally, it houses the Palladian Loggia Valmarana, which is reflected in the nearby waters, creating a picturesque scene.
name: Salvi Gardens Vicenza
address: Corso SS. Felice e Fortunato, 3, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: Piazza with elegant palaces, grand columns topped with statues & an imposing Renaissance basilica.
detail_description: Piazza dei Signori is a stunning square that showcases the architectural brilliance of Andrea Palladio, featuring elegant palaces and grand columns adorned with statues. The imposing Renaissance basilica at its heart serves as a remarkable public space rather than just a church, housing traditional shops and cafes beneath its porticoes. Visitors can also admire the Teatro Olimpico, an unfinished masterpiece by Palladio, along with other exquisite buildings lining Contra Porti.
name: Piazza dei Signori
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Catholic Church of San Lorenzo is a large and impressive brick building with an ornate entrance. The inside is filled with beautiful tombs, a 1500 fresco by Bartolomeo Montagna depicting the Beheading of St. Paul, and other impressive statues. It is more impressive than the Cathedral, making it worth visiting if you only have time in Vicenza.
name: Church of San Lorenzo
address: Piazza S. Lorenzo, 2, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

excerpt: This contemporary museum features religious art & artifacts related to the Vicentine Church.
detail_description: The Museo Diocesano di Vicenza is a contemporary museum that houses religious art and artifacts related to the Vicentine Church. It is located in the Bishop's Palace, which has been expanded and renovated over the centuries. The museum offers a unique experience for visitors, combining guided tours with visual and interactive elements. Visitors can explore early Christian Vicenza through immersive events and discover unique features like the crypto portico.
name: Museo Diocesano
address: Piazza del Duomo, 12, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Roman Cryptoporticus in Vicenza is a fascinating archaeological site dating back to the first century BC. This underground structure, located beneath the Palazzetto Proti and the Cathedral of Vicenza, is one of the few remaining examples of its kind. Originally used by the inhabitants to seek relief from summer heat, it was later covered entirely. The site offers a glimpse into the original town's architecture and historical significance.
name: Roman cryptoporticus
address: Piazza del Duomo, 6, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Museo del Risorgimento e della Resistenza in Vicenza is located on the Ambellicopoli hill, near Villa Guiccioli and the Monte Berico Sanctuary. The museum focuses on Italian unification, World War I, and World War II. It features a vast English garden open to the public. The museum showcases collections and documents that narrate the remarkable story of Italy's struggle for freedom.
name: Museo del Risorgimento e della Resistenza
address: Viale Dieci Giugno, 115, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Casa Pigafetta, a renowned historical landmark in Vicenza, is an exquisite example of Gothic architecture. It boasts a magnificent facade adorned with Arabesque-style windows on the first and second floors. The building holds great significance as it was not only the birthplace but also the residence of Antonio Pigafetta, the famous Vicenza navigator. A dedicated inscription honoring his name can be found on the facade.
name: Casa Pigafetta
address: Contrà Antonio Pigafetta, 11, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: After its restoration, an internal hall in the Pawnshop Palace is dedicated to various activities such as exhibitions, conferences, literary gatherings, and more. This historically and artistically significant palace holds a prime strategic position with an opening facing the Palladian Basilica. The art exhibitions are consistently well-coordinated and showcase local artists from Vicenza and beyond. These artistic displays are further enhanced within this particular room, adding to the overall value of the venue.
name: Pawnshop Palace in Vicenza
address: Contrà del Monte, 13, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Located in the heart of Vicenza, next to the Palladian Basilica, the Torre del Tormento E Arco degli Zavattieri stands as a significant historical landmark with a rich thousand-year history. Constructed by the Carnaroli family during the 12th century, it served as a prison for Silvio Pellico and endured centuries of use as a site of torture. Aptly named "Torre del tormento," this tower bears witness to its dark past.
name: Torre del Tormento e Arco degli Zavattieri
address: Contra della Catena, 21, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

name: Porto Palace, Vicenza
address: Piazza Castello, 18, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo da Schio, Ca' d'Oro is a stunning historical building with a richly decorated facade that captivates visitors with its intricate figures and symbols. The atrium houses a small archaeological collection, while the cobbled courtyard boasts picturesque wisterias. This sumptuous residence on the Grand Canal offers more than just history; it also features a used book shop, wine sales from the owners' lands, and a clothes shop within its inner courtyard.
name: Palazzo da Schio, Ca' d'Oro
address: Corso Andrea Palladio, 147, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

name: Monumento Neri Pozza
address: Contra Pescaria, 24, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Oasi WWF degli Stagni di Casale "Alberto Carta" is a 22-hectare nature reserve located near Vicenza. It offers a variety of experiences, including educational ponds, observation points, and guided tours led by passionate volunteers. Visitors can explore the diverse landscape on foot or by motor vehicles. The reserve is home to numerous bird species, amphibians, and reptiles, making it an ideal destination for nature enthusiasts of all ages.
name: Oasi WWF degli Stagni di Casale "Alberto Carta"
address: Via Ludovico Lazzaro Zamenhof, 296, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

name: Romeo Menti Stadium
address: 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: In February, visitors stumbled upon Azienda Agricola di Pieriboni e Figli winery without prior notice, and were highly impressed by the warm reception from the hosts. The owners, three brothers passionate about their craft, showcased their dedication through the exceptional quality of their wine. Valscura stood out as a particularly enjoyable choice. Despite being unprepared for the visit due to off-season circumstances, the hosts still generously served sausages alongside the wine tasting experience, refusing any payment.
name: Azienda Agricola di Pieriboni e Figli
address: Via Mason, 13, 36054 Montebello Vicentino VI, Italy

detail_description: The Church of San Rocco, located at the end of contra San Rocco, features a modest facade and an enchanting interior. This Catholic church serves as the backdrop for a traditional bell concert during the Christmas season. Additionally, it is worth noting that this historical site is situated approximately 2 km away from the Corte Segreta bed and breakfast in Vicenza.
name: Church of San Rocco
address: Contrà Mure S. Rocco, 28, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

name: Arch Of The Little Stairs
address: Piazzale Fraccon, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: The Scultura di Andrea Palladio is an architectural masterpiece that pays homage to the renowned Italian architect, Andrea Palladio. This monument showcases intricate craftsmanship and design. It stands as a testament to Palladio's genius and his significant contributions to the field of architecture. The sculpture captures the essence of his iconic works, displaying elegance, symmetry, and grandeur. The structure serves as a symbol of inspiration for aspiring architects and admirers of classical architecture around the world.
name: Scultura di Andrea Palladio
address: Contrà Camillo Benso Cavour, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Vicenza, the Oratory of San Nicola da Tolentino is a hidden gem that beautifully marries history and art. Originally constructed in the 1500s, this oratory has undergone various renovations over the years, resulting in its striking neoclassical facade. Step inside to discover a Baroque interior featuring a single nave adorned with exquisite artworks.
name: Oratory of San Nicola da Tolentino, Vicenza
address: Stradella S. Nicola, 2, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy

detail_description: Located just outside Vicenza's historic center, Oasi della Valletta del Silenzio is a serene green space adjacent to the famous Villa Capra la Rotonda. While tourists flock to the villa, this oasis offers a peaceful escape with its picturesque countryside retreat. Visitors can relax, sunbathe, or enjoy family picnics amidst rolling hills and lush greenery. It's an ideal spot for walking, running, or simply unwinding in nature's tranquility.
name: Oasi della Valletta del Silenzio
address: Stradella della Rotonda, 36100 Vicenza VI, Italy
